Articles.Content:
Just another one of my side projects in early development. Meant to be an extremely light weight manned pod. After cutbacks at the KSP, engineers were required to come up with creative solutions. They figured, 9 out of 10 kerbals die at launch, why waste all of that money on command pods? And they're always in their suits anyways. Thus they came up with the cardboard command pod! Get ready for a bumpy ride....here at KSP our new motto is, "It's not only safe, it's safe enough!".

Edited October 12, 2013 by trekkie_
you should add a heat shield bit for the bottom.

you should add a heat shield bit for the bottom.

Made of tinfoil.

you should add a heat shield bit for the bottom.
Made of tinfoil.

And a window made of cellophane.
Those are both great suggestions! This reminds me of that '80s movie Explorers where the kids build a rocket from junk.
Now I feel the weird urge to sing "I'm livin' in a box! I'm livin' in a cardboard box!".

I am trying to think of other things that would fit into this sort of theme - landing legs made from old springs, stuff like that.

(Also, duct tape is good for seams!)

Edited October 12, 2013 by HeadHunter67

Satellite dish made out of a metal colander.

Struts where the end points look like safety pins.
tinfoil heatshield, check
Can you imagine the inside of this thing?
decouplers made out of rings of tape?

Can you imagine the inside of this thing?

I'm down with a custom IVA where all the dials are hand drawn on with a marker. Bonus points to imagination if you make it actually work and give you useful information.

Its awesome idea.

Garbage rocket parts. Plastic bootle engine and sode+metnos booster.

soda = liquid fuel

mentos = oxidizer

I had pictured as far as something like a cardboard engine as well, but would be cool to have a bunch of wacky parts that work in concert with each other.
And wooden spoons as a joystick/ throttle combination

I actually pictured a spatula as the throttle lol.

that oughta be enough to get to mun

Edited October 12, 2013 by trekkie_

Can you imagine the inside of this thing?

Well if it's anything like the ones I made as a kid, it will have a lot of Duck tape and black marker control panels with a broken lawn chair for the seat.
WOW gies wee all need to take a step back this is too funny.
Everything on this thread would be awesome. I would certainly download a parts mod in this style.

I don't think it should go beyond the 1.25m territory with themed parts, otherwise they'll be ridiculously big.

there's a lot of variations it could have that are hard to choose from.

1) sodacan+mentos = just fuel tanks

2) sodacan+mentos = fuel+engine alone (solid booster or not)

3) sodacan+mentos = fuel tank for 2 liter bottle engine

here's what I've got so far combined, not necessarily in this sizing or configuration.

...and more

of course it would be nice to have some alternative sizes/configuration possibilities, for high/low thrust, and high atm/vac operations, so that way a person can build atleast a ship with the possibility for a smallish lander.

Edited October 13, 2013 by trekkie_

Wow, that's seriously cool!

Hmmm, maybe fire extinguishers for RCS? hahaha
I wish to humbly request bent drinking straws pulled taut by strings for retractable landing legs.
Plastic grocery bag as a parachute. Come'on, you can't tell me none of you guys didn't do that as a kid!

Great idea on the chute!

My wife thinks the heat shield looks like a Jiffy-Pop container... which actually would be a good way to cushion a landing, and the Kerbals would have a tasty snack post-flight!

I told her animating a heat shield that "pops" during descent might be tricky, but you guys might know how to do it.
IVA could look like a pizza box was used.
